history.content:
Assuming there are no barriers to students with your major being enrolled, I believe you describe accurately how the new system works.

Unfortunately, there is no way to check which waitlist position you are in the section you're currently enrolled in.  I agree it would make life easier for many students to decide whether to drop and readd and I hope that at some point it will be possible.

children.subject: yes, it went just as I expected it would. Went from 30 to 190th on the waitlist, and a day later I got into the class.
To the person who created this post: Were you able to successfully enroll by dropping and adding an empty section?

history.content:
So for a class, say cs168, if people like me who are waitlisted in a section that is soon to be full/full, by dropping the class altogether and reenrolling in a section that has more available seats than waitlisted students it will be a guaranteed entry into the class by the time everyone on the waitlist is processed? Something like in the overall class waitlist you'll be placed at the very end, but when each section is individually processed you will be put ahead of people who were higher than you because they enrolled in a section that ended up being full?

Also is there any way to check which waitlist position you are in the section you're currently enrolled in? Would make my life easier to decide whether to drop and readd.
history.subject: enrolling by dropping and adding an empty section
